result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and surcharges due within term of ES in count two.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. As DNA sample/mandatory surcharge are ordered in count two, fee waived as to count one.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to any other sentence.  To be served in WSP.
Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other senence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid presription.  No contact with drug community or Juan F. or Feliciano R.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Robert Tuchalski

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (24 pages) SENTENCING HEARNG, commencing MAY 11, 2015, received and filed.
Case converted at request of Leah Miller, Court Reporter.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0.  
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 
COUNT 1:
  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONCURRENT with count 2 but consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days served; to be served in WSP.  Costs and surcharges due within term of ES in Count 2, if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  As DNA sample/mandatory surcharge are ordered in Count 2, the are waived as to Count 1.  

COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, concurrent with Count 1, but consecutive  to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 years,with the following conditions:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Juan F. or Feliciano R.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  On motion of the State Court ordered Counts 1 and 2, Repeater portion, to be stricken.

AS TO COUNTS 3:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 3 DISMISSED-READ IN.

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.   Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: 
Victims: Rogaciano R, Juan F., or either of their residence and out buildings.  
Witnesses: Dorothy T., Deonne H.,  or their residence or 2720 S 13t Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  
Defendant Joseph Robert Tuchalski in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

case passed at 4:29 for defendant to be interviewed by counsel. 

Case recalled at 4:47pm
Same appearances.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
